section.title: Install the Compute agent for Telemetry
section.para: Telemetry is composed of an API service, a collector and a range of disparate agents. This section explains how to install and configure the agent that runs on the compute node.

step.para: Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file and add the following lines to the [DEFAULT] section:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... instance_usage_audit = True instance_usage_audit_period = hour notify_on_state_change = vm_and_task_state notification_driver = nova.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier notification_driver = ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier

procedure.title: To configure the Compute agent for Telemetry
procedure.para: Edit the /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf file and complete the following actions:

step.para: In the [publisher] section, set the secret key for Telemetry service nodes:
step.programlisting: [publisher] # Secret value for signing metering messages (string value) metering_secret = CEILOMETER_TOKEN
step.para: Replace CEILOMETER_TOKEN with the ceilometer token that you created previously.
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure RabbitMQ broker access:
Replace RABBIT_PASS with the password you chose for the guest account in RabbitMQ.
In the [keystone_authtoken] section, configure Identity service access:
step.programlisting: [keystone_authtoken] auth_uri = http://controller:5000/v2.0 identity_uri = http://controller:35357 admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = ceilometer admin_password = CEILOMETER_PASS
step.para: Replace CEILOMETER_PASS with the password you chose for the Telemetry module database.

note.para: Comment out the auth_host, auth_port, and auth_protocol keys, since they are replaced by the identity_uri and auth_uri keys.

step.para: In the [service_credentials] section, configure service credentials:
step.programlisting: [service_credentials] os_auth_url = http://controller:5000/v2.0 os_username = ceilometer os_tenant_name = service os_password = CEILOMETER_PASS os_endpoint_type = internalURL
step.para: Replace CEILOMETER_PASS with the password you chose for the ceilometer user in the Identity service.
